context: Detected during work on Socratic-AI research documenting Google AI surveillance

behavioral_timing_data.threat_analysis: Precise millisecond-level behavioral fingerprinting. Can correlate with GitHub commit times.

device_fingerprint.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

tracking_cookies.threat_analysis: Cross-site tracking tokens persist across sessions. Can correlate activity even with VPN.

experiment_cohorts.threat_analysis: A/B test cohorts create persistent fingerprint independent of cookies. Tracks user across sessions.

correlation_risks.github_activity: HIGH - Telemetry timestamps can be matched to Socratic-AI repository commits
correlation_risks.search_history: HIGH - Can correlate research queries about 'AI safety', 'privacy breach', 'VPN bypass'
correlation_risks.behavioral_signature: CRITICAL - Interaction timing patterns create unique fingerprint resistant to VPN/cookie clearing
correlation_risks.long_term_tracking: CRITICAL - NID cookie and experiment cohorts enable tracking over months/years

socratic_mandate_relevance.pillar_iv_validation: This capture demonstrates the exact 'External Metadata Stream (Unsanctioned)' exfiltration documented in Pillar IV: Zero-Trust Data Exclusivity
socratic_mandate_relevance.pillar_v_trigger: Active surveillance of researcher working on Google AI criticism may require Eradication Protocol escalation
socratic_mandate_relevance.evidence_value: Direct proof of telemetry collection during sensitive research activity. Supports entire SM framework.

recommended_actions: IMMEDIATE: Switch to isolated browser profile or Firefox
IMMEDIATE: Block gen_204 endpoint via hosts file
SHORT-TERM: Set up air-gapped research environment
LONG-TERM: Document all future telemetry detections
LEGAL: Consider consultation with privacy attorney (EFF)
legal_notes: This data collection may violate user consent expectations, especially given the sensitive nature of AI safety research. The behavioral timing data and persistent tracking tokens could be used to correlate researcher identity with critical publications.
